title: (x) Russh Magazine - Didoni, Bauer Bodoni {Patricia}
content:
Hi,  
Can someone please identify this typeface?

Many Thanks!

Paul.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [russh\_magazine.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20130219014853/http:/typophile.com/files/russh_magazine_0.gif) | 18.88 KB |
author: pbags

comments.content:
it looks like Annlie = [http://www.linotype.com/88630/annlieextrabold-font.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20130219014853/http:/www.linotype.com/88630/annlieextrabold-font.html "http://www.linotype.com/88630/annlieextrabold-font.html")  
and a bit like Falstaff = [http://www.linotype.com/13506/falstaffregular-font.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20130219014853/http:/www.linotype.com/13506/falstaffregular-font.html "http://www.linotype.com/13506/falstaffregular-font.html")

my best guess is that the R is Falstaff, and the rest is Annlie, redesigned...

RUSSH looks like Didoni kerned tight. It also resembles Sahara Bodoni but I think it's Didoni.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/didoni/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130219014853/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/didoni/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/didoni/")

CONTENTS looks like Bauer Bodoni bold

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/bauer-bodoni/ef-bold/testdrive.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20130219014853/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/bauer-bodoni/ef-bold/testdrive.html "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/bauer-bodoni/ef-bold/testdrive.html")
It's that pesky Keyword Search - I'd never have found it otherwise.
